name: Lynne H. Walling
content:
Lynne H. Walling is Reader in Pure Mathematics at the University of Bristol.[1] She is known for her research in  number theory.[2]
 Walling received her Ph.D. from Dartmouth College in 1987 under Thomas Richard Shemanske.[3] Walling worked at University of Colorado, Boulder and the National Science Foundation before joining the University of Bristol in 2007, where she became Head of Pure Maths.[2]
 In 2012, Walling became a fellow of the American Mathematical Society.[4]

Lynne H. Walling is Reader in Pure Mathematics at the University of Bristol.[1] She is known for her research in  number theory.[2]

Contents

1 Career
2 Awards and honors
3 Selected publications
4 References


Career[edit]
Walling received her Ph.D. from Dartmouth College in 1987 under Thomas Richard Shemanske.[3] Walling worked at University of Colorado, Boulder and the National Science Foundation before joining the University of Bristol in 2007, where she became Head of Pure Maths.[2]

Awards and honors[edit]
In 2012, Walling became a fellow of the American Mathematical Society.[4]

Selected publications[edit]
Hafner, James Lee; Walling, Lynne H. Explicit action of Hecke operators on Siegel modular forms. J. Number Theory 93 (2002), no. 1, 34–57.
Walling, Lynne H. Hecke operators on theta series attached to lattices of arbitrary rank. Acta Arith. 54 (1990), no. 3, 213–240.
Merrill, Kathy D.; Walling, Lynne H. Sums of squares over function fields. Duke Math. J. 71 (1993), no. 3, 665–684.
